description.p: This event fires every time the Grid is executed. This includes every Ajax callback.

page.discussion: This event fires every time the Grid is run, including every Ajax callback. You can use this event to override certain Grid settings. The Grid settings are in e.tmpl.

section.description: The following variables are available to you in the event:

item.name: e.rtc
item.description: Run-time calculations (allows you to pass data to other event handlers)

item.name: e.ajaxCallback
item.description: .f. if this is the initial load of the Grid. .t. if this is an Ajax callback.

section.title: Example
section.example:
'Set the Grid rows per page to 20 e.tmpl.rows = 20
'Set the style e.tmpl.style_name = "GlassOlive"

description.p: You can also set state variables in this event. The value of any state variables will be available in all subsequent ajax callbacks (in the e.__si2 object).

see.ref: How to Override Grid Component Settings in an .a5w page or OnGridExecute event
